newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil April pulp exports up 17 pct on 1996-Abecel.
newsitem.headline: Brazil April pulp exports up 17 pct on 1996-Abecel.

text.p: Brazilian pulp exports totalled 220,000 tonnes in April, up 17 percent from the same month last year, the Brazilian Pulp Exporters' Association (Abecel) said in a statement.
In the first four months of this year, Brazil exported 808,784 tonnes, up 27 percent on the corresponding period in 1996, it added.
Europe was the main buyer in April, increasing its purchases by 22 percent to 87,000 tonnes.
Over the four month period, Europe imported 311,118 tonnes of Brazilian pulp, up 49 percent from the 209,017 tonnes purchased in January to April 1996.
Asia was the next key buyer, importing 301,146 tonnes, an increase of 35 percent on the 223,079 tonnes bought in the first four months of last year.
Abecel consists of the country's five main pulp exporters - Aracruz Celulose SA, Bahia Sul Celulose SA, Cenibra, Jari Celulose SA and Riocell SA.
Production by the five firms reached 892,000 tonnes in the first four months of this year, up 11 percent from the same period in 1996, the statement said.
